Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for load balancing, including traffic distribution, redundancy, and failover needs. Identify the applications and services that will use the Azure Load Balancer.
Design the architecture for the Azure Load Balancer, including frontend IP configurations, backend pools, health probes, and load balancing rules.
Create the Azure Load Balancer in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Configure the basic settings such as SKU (Standard or Basic) and region.
Set up the frontend IP configuration for the Load Balancer, including public or private IP addresses based on the requirements.
Create and configure the backend pool, specifying the virtual machines or virtual machine scale sets that will receive traffic.
Configure health probes to monitor the availability of backend resources. Define probe settings such as protocol, port, and interval.
Define load balancing rules to specify how traffic is distributed across the backend pool. Configure settings such as protocol, port, and session persistence.
Apply security best practices such as Network Security Groups (NSGs), Azure DDoS Protection, and access control policies to secure the Load Balancer.
Perform thorough testing of the Load Balancer setup, including traffic distribution, failover scenarios, and backend resource availability.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for health probe failures, backend pool availability, and traffic metrics.
Document the Load Balancer architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the Load Balancer setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
